intro: Muretia amplifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved muretia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Muretia amplifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests.
